US MARKET WRAP 15 April 2019: Markets boxed into thin range; mixed bank earnings
content:
* SNAP SHOT: Equities flat, dollar flat, Treasuries down, crude down.

* REAR VIEW: China mulling shifting agricultural tariffs; Fed’s Evans toes neutral line; bank earnings mixed.

* AHEAD: UK Employment Data; German & EU ZEW Economic Sentiment; US Industrial Production & Manufacturing Output; New Zealand CPI; Fed Discount Rate Minutes; Fed’s Rosengren & Kaplan Speaking; Supply from Japan & UK; Earnings from: IBM, Johnson & Johnson, Netflix, UnitedHealth Group, CSX, Bank of America, BlackRock

* TRADE: The main development on Monday out of the US-China trade front was that that China is reportedly looking at shifting tariffs from US agricultural goods onto other products, a move that would gain political points for US President Trump, where he can frame the shift as a win for US farmers. On the US-EU front, it was reported that EU members have agreed to begin trade negotiations with the US, This followed source reports on Thursday that European governments had struck an agreement on the bloc's negotiating mandate ahead of formal trade talks with the US.

* FED: Fed’s Evans (voter, neutral) said on Monday morning that US data has strengthened over the last few weeks and the economy is solid; he can envisage a scenario where the Fed fund rate is to be flat/unchanged through Fall of 2020. However, later comments revealed that he sees risks from downside scenarios looming larger than those from the upside, and the most recent data on the US economy has been on the soft side. when questioned if a cut was on the Fed’s agenda, he said there would have to be a negative shock for it to be considered, but he did later say that a cut is a scenario he sees in order to support inflation although that is not his base case. Evans said that the December rate hike was not a mistake and is comfortable with current monetary policy settings, emphasising that the Fed can be data dependent until pressures lead to inflation; and on that subject, the Chicago Fed President said it is currently weaker than he would like to see, which concerns him, and that he would be willing for inflation to rise up to 2.5% provided that there was a path for it to be managed back down closer to 2%.

* BOC BUSINESS OUTLOOK SURVEY: The release was judged to be neutral/dovish, confirming the softness in growth metrics. ”The results are broadly consistent with our expectation for a prolonged policy hold at least through to the end of the year in anticipation of a rebound in domestic growth and improved global risks.” The main takeaways, Scotia said, are that Canadian businesses are not even remotely in the camp of expecting a US recession and see sales growth modestly improving through the course of next year. “Nevertheless, their investment and hiring intentions softened but point to expansion, and they suddenly indicate much less capacity pressure overall and through labour shortages, I personally view with a lot of suspicion.” Scotia notes “The advantage to this survey is that it can provide fairly timely anecdotes and intentions to inform growth tracking and forecasts. The disadvantage is that its usefulness as a forward looking gauge is limited by its tendency to be a reactionary and contemporaneous signal of developments.”

* WTI (K9) SETTLES $0.49 LOWER AT $63.40/BBL; BRENT (M9) SETTLES $0.37 LOWER AT $71.18/BBL. The crude complex pared some of last weeks gains on Monday, but remained within range from the YTD highs. Iranian Oil Minister Zanganeh on the weekend said  the oil market is fragile due to US pressures on Iran and Venezuela, and tensions in Libya; “He may be talking his book, but these are important elements in the bullish price scenario,” analysts at Citigroup added. On a more technical front, Reuters energy analyst John Kemp notes that fund managers have continued to add to their long positions in the recent week, “the market is starting to look stretched and the balance of risks is shifting to the downside”, with the aggregate long positions outnumbering the short positions by a ratio of 7:1; commenting on the shift from net short to net long positioning in the YTD period, “By April, however, the concentrated long positioning started to signal a likely reversal in the rally, or at least a pause, if fund managers attempt to take some profits.” Following last week’s bipolar US crude inventory report, with the large crude build being offset by a greater magnitude draw in gasoline stocks, this week’s estimates see crude building 1.9mln bbls, gasoline stocks drawing 2.4mln bbls, and distillates drawing 0.9mln bbls; Genscape forecasts Cushing, Oklahoma, drawing 2mln bbls.

* SPX -0.1% at 2906, NDX +0.0% at 7629, DJI -0.1% at 26384. SECTORS: Communications +0.4%, Cons Discretionary +0.2%, Cons Staples +0.7%, Energy -0.6%, Financials -0.6%, Healthcare +0.4%, Industrials -0.5%, Materials -0.5%, Tech +0.0%, Telecoms +0.2%, Utilities +0.0%.

* STOCKS SPECIFICS: Goldman Sachs (GS) shares traded lower after the investment bank reported lower than expected revenues. Boeing (BA) shares fall after brand consultancy firm said negative publicity regarding the 737 groundings could cost the brand up to USD 12bln. Citigroup (C) shares fell after the bank reported mixed first-quarter results, where EPS came in above expectations but overall revenues came in below. United Airlines (UAL) shares fell after the airline announced that it had joined American Airlines in further grounding Boeing’s (BA) 737 Max, saying it wants to wait until independent regulators have deemed the aircraft safe. Alliance Data Systems (ADS) shares dropped on valuations concerns regarding the data co.’s Epsilon unit which it is selling to Publicis Groupe for USD 4.4bln. Advanced Disposal Services (ADSW) shares soared on reports that Waste Management Inc. (WM) had offered to buy the firm for roughly USD 3bln. Spotify Technology (SPOT) shares fell after reports emerged that Amazon (AMZN) was to launch a music streaming service. Levi Strauss & Co (LEVI) shares traded higher off the back of upgrades from JP Morgan Chase and Morgan Stanley.

* US T-NOTE FUTURES (M9) SETTLE 2 TICKS HIGHER AT 123-05. Yields started the week off higher on US/China trade deal optimism, but the rise was modest and after testing fresh 3.5 week highs, in quiet conditions in a holiday-shortened week, yields drifted lower for the TPLEX to finish slightly higher by settle.

* FX WRAP: The Buck is mixed, trading around neutral as we head into the APAC session, after a quiet-ish session, where yields saw only limited action, and the SPX was mostly stuck within a tight range. The Loonie weakened by around half a point, while 2yr yields dropped 3bps after a neutral/dovish BOC Business Outlook Survey. While lawmakers are on holiday, GBP had a Brexit-free session, leaving traders to focus on the technical, though action was gravitating around 1.31, where chunky GBP 1.39bln expiry rolls off at Tuesday’s NY cut. Similarly, there wasn’t any A-List data on the European docket, leaving EUR straddling 1.13 unchanged levels. JPY was also quiet around the 112.00 mark, mostly ignoring dovish Kuroda comments (that were recorded on Saturday, and aired on CNBC in the US morning). AUD was also uneventful, with traders eyeing the jobs data out later in the week. EMFX was weaker against the buck.

subject: Daily FX Wrap: Sterling shines as Dollar lacks lustre and Loonie loses ground late on
content:
GBP

The Pound appears to be revelling in the relative lack of Brexit-related headlines during the UK Parliament recess, or at least relieved with the break from almost constant Whitehall media coverage. However, low level talks between the Tories and Labour are ongoing over Easter and are said to have been more in-depth and positive than anticipated thus far, according to Foreign Secretary Hunt. Cable is inching above 1.3100 and closer to near term resistance in the form of last Friday’s 1.3132 peak and the 30 DMA, while Eur/Gbp has slipped back from near 0.8650 highs towards 0.8520 even though the single currency is holding firm vs the Dollar and other G10 counterparts.

CAD

The Loonie crept up on the blindside and largely shrugged off weaker crude and poor Canadian existing home sales to probe back above 1.3300 vs its US peer. However, gains were erased and more to a fresh low circa 1.3390 on the back of the BoC’s Spring Business Outlook Survey as the headline index turned a tad negative and the snapshot is for a moderation from high levels of domestic and foreign demand across most regions, albeit with investment and employment intentions still positive. Back to Usd/Cad, last week’s high was 1.3396 and then 1.3400 will be a round number target. 

EUR/AUD/NZD/JPY/CHF

The Euro has lost some of its early momentum vs the Buck and across the board as Eur/Usd stalled ahead of resistance at 1.1324 and 1.1341 (Fib and 200 WMA respectively). However, the headline pair remains technically firm if not outright bullish while above another Fib level at 1.1284 and as long as the Usd does not continue to rebound in wake of an upbeat NY Fed manufacturing survey. On that note, the DXY has pared losses from 96.780 to retest the top of Monday’s range so far (96.937), but not quite 97.000 and it remains to be seen whether it can close above the 30 DMA (96.891). Meanwhile, Aud/Usd and Nzd/Usd are off best levels within 0.7182-64 and 0.6782-56 respective parameters, but the Aussie in particular remains underpinned as Aud/Nzd crosses 1.0600 amidst positive reports surrounding US-China trade (former said to have relaxed industrial subsidy demands and latter reportedly mulling whether to shift agricultural tariffs in response to a request by Washington). Elsewhere, Usd/Jpy is pivoting 112.00 and its ytd high vs 200 WMA (112.14-111.98), with BoJ Governor Kuroda blaming weak wage growth for the lack of overall inflation, adding that it remains possible to lower long term and rates in general if requited, while Usd/Chf is hugging higher ground between 1.0010-39, like Eur/Chf within a 1.1325-46 band.

EM 

The Lira continues underperform and inch closer to recent lows vs the Greenback on domestic politics, diplomatic strains and more disappointing Turkish data (as jobless rate and budget balance both deteriorated). Moreover, some reports about an investment meeting at the IMF/World Bank over the weekend have been far from encouraging with Usd/Try currently hovering near 5.8000.

subject: BOC Business Outlook Survey Indicator (Spring 2019): -0.6 (Prev. 2.19)
content:
• Click here for the release
  • The Business Outlook Survey (BOS) indicator declined from a strongly positive level in the winter survey and is now slightly negative, suggesting a softening in business sentiment
  • Global trade headwinds and geopolitical tensions are affecting firms’ operations
  • The balance of opinion on terms and conditions for obtaining financing moved back toward an easing, however, most firms continue to report credit conditions as unchanged over the past three months.
  • Businesses expect input price growth to stabilize over the next 12 months, as indicated by a balance of opinion near zero
  • indicators of labour shortages have decreased, signalling that pressures on labour markets are less widespread than in the winter survey
  • After several quarters of elevated capacity pressures, the share of firms that would have difficulty meeting an unanticipated increase in demand has moved down to a low level
  • Business activity indicator on past sales growth has moved down to near zero, suggesting that the pace of sales growth has moderated slightly over the past 12 months after a strong year
reaction_details: • In an immediate reaction, USD/CAD rose from 1.3310 to 1.3346

subject: PRIMER: BoC Quarterly Business Outlook Survey
content: Ahead of the BOC rate decision on 24 April, the quarterly BOC outlook survey is seen slipping slightly from the 2.19 reading in the previous report, RBC believes. The bank points to soft data (PMI and CFIB) which hint at some cooling in activity. However, BOC governor Poloz in a recent speech said that firms were accelerating their investment plans following government rule changes last year, and therefore, RBC argues that investment intentions may hold up well, while other survey questions around slack and sales growth may be softer. "Inflation expectations have been in the upper end of the BOC's 1-3% range for the past four quarters, but that looks more tied to actual inflation and could fall this time, the bank says, in line with the actual inflation data. The bank also reminds us that, as usual, the BOC's qualitative commentary will be as important as the survey numbers.

  • Citigroup Inc (C) Q1 EPS USD 1.87 vs. exp. USD 1.80, revenue USD 18.58bln vs. exp. USD 18.63bln. FICC revenues USD 3.45bln vs. exp. USD 3.18bln; Equity Markets revenue USD 842mln, -24% YY vs. exp. USD 927mln; IB revenue up 20% YY USD 1.35bln vs. exp. 1.16bln. (Newswires)
  • Goldman Sachs (GS) Q1 EPS USD 5.71 vs. exp. USD 4.89, revenue USD 8.81bln exp. USD 8.99bln, FICC revenue USD 1.84bln exp. USD 1.78bln; says FICC execution lower due to lower revenue in rates products, currencies and credit products. Raises dividend by USD 0.05 to USD 0.85 per share. (Newswires)
  • M&T Bank Corp (MTB) Q1 Operating EPS USD 3.38 vs. exp. USD 3.3, revenue USD 1.56bln vs. exp. USD 1.51bln, net interest margin 4.04% vs. prev. 3.71%. (Newswires)

DJIA

  • Apple (AAPL) – The tech co.’s largest supplier, Foxconn, announced that its CEO Terry Gou is looking to retire next year “to pave the way for younger talent”. (Newswires)
  • Boeing (BA) – Boeing has been awarded a USD 14.3bln for the modification, modernisation, engineering, engineering sustainment and test of B-1/B-2 weapons system. (Newswire)
  • Merck (MRK) – has released results from a clinical trial evaluating the efficacy and safety of Zerbaxa, a pneumonia treatment. The results showed non-inferiority to meropenem, the active comparator. (Newswire)
  • Microsoft (MSFT) – The tech co. suffered from a hack between January 1st to March 28th, where the co. announced that hackers were able to access email content from a large number of “Outlook, MSN, and Hotmail email accounts by abusing a Microsoft customer support portal.” (Motherboard)
  • Pfizer (PFE) – the pharma co has released positive data following its Phase 2 study of vaccine candidate, PF-06482077, which treats pneumonia. The findings from this study support progression to Phase 3 clinical development. (Newswire)
  • Verizon (VZ) – the telecoms co. has said that the FCC’s 5G actions are paving a path that will keep Verizon and the US as a Network leader. (Newswire)

S&P500

  • Allergan (AGN) – Independent proxy advisory firms Institutional Shareholder Services and Glass Lewis & Co. have both recommended that shareholders voter in favour for the pharma co.’s proposals and against the activist investors calling for a separation of the Chair and CEO role. (Newswires)
  • Alliance Data (ADS), Publicis (PUBGY) – Alliance Data Systems has agreed to sell its Epsilon business to Publicis Groupe for USD 4.4bln cash, representing 10 times trailing 12-month EBITDA. The transaction is expected to close in Q3. (Newswire)
  • American Airlines (AAL), Boeing (BA) – American Airlines has pulled all Boeing 737 Max aeroplanes from its summer schedule, saying the decision will give passengers more certainty in making vacation plans. The aircraft is being pulled until at least August 2019. (Newswire)
  • Best Buy (BBY) – The electronics retailer has promoted its CFO and Chief Strategic Transformation Officer, Corie Barry, to the position of CEO, where current CEO and Chairman Hubert Joly will assume the new role of Executive Chairman. (Newswires)
  • CVS Health (CVS) – Barron’s publication wrote positively on the health care stock this weekend, saying that following the recent underperformance, its assets leave it “uniquely well positioned” for the future. (Barron’s)
  • Goldcorp (GG), Newmont (NEM) – Goldcorp announced that Newmont Mining has received Investment Canada Act approval regarding its previously announced plans to acquire all outstanding shares of Goldcorp, meaning there are now no further regulatory, or shareholder approvals required. The transaction is to close by 18 April and the combined entity will be called Newmont Goldcorp. (Newswire)
  • Mattel (MAT) – The toy manufacturer announced that it has recalled all models of Fisher-Price’s Rock ‘n Play Sleeper due to reports of incidents in which the product was used contrary to the safety warnings and instructions. (Newswire)
  • PG&E (PCG), Edison International (EIX) – California Governor Gavin Newsom has called on state lawmakers to find a way to help utilities that have been damaged by wildfires, including PG&E (PCG) and Edison (EIX). Southern California Edison, the largest subsidiary of Edison International has said that it is encouraged by the scope of California Governor Newsom’s report, which addresses critical wildfire issues including prevention. (Newswire)
  • State Street (STT) – the financial services co. announced it has appointed Francisco Aristeguieta as CEO of its international business, who most previously served as CEO of Citigroup’s Asia business. (Newswire)
  • Tobacco retailers (WMT, KR, CVX, XOM, MPC) – The FDA has sent letters to tobacco retailers requesting them to lay out plans of action for preventing sales to under-age individuals within 30 days, threating fines if not. (CNBC)
  • Waste Management (WM), Advanced Disposal Services (ADSW) – Waste Management is to acquire Advanced Disposal Services for an approximate 22% premium to the closing price on April 12th at USD 33.15 per share, for an enterprise value of USD 4.9bln, assuming USD 1.9bln of Advanced Disposal’s debt. Waste Management sees more than USD 100mln in annual cost and capex synergies. (Newswires)

NASDAQ

  • Alphabet (GOOGL), Facebook (FB) – EU members have backed reform measures to copyright rules which would force Google to pay publishers for news snippets and Facebook to filter out protected content. (Newswires)
  • Amazon (AMZN) – Employees at the retailer’s logistic centres in Germany have gone on strike, where more could join throughout the week, the co. said there is no operational impact from the strike in regard to deliveries. (Newswires)
  • Amazon (AMZN), Spotify (SPOT) – Amazon is looking to launch a free music streaming service, which could come as soon as next week, and is said to be marketed through its Echo speakers. (Billboard)
  • Electronic Arts (EA), Microsoft (MSFT), Sony (SNE) – Respawn Entertainment, a studio of Electronic Arts, announced a new Star Wars third-person action adventure game to be launched 15 November 2019 on Microsoft’s Xbox and Sony’s PS4. (Newswire)
  • Facebook (FB) – the social media co. suffered a third major global outage this year, with users unable to access the social network for any of its services including Facebook messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp for a few hours on Sunday morning. (Newswire)
  • Facebook (FB), PayPal (PYPL) – Facebook has announced that Peggy Alford, PayPal’s Senior Vice President of Core Markets, has been nominated to its board of directors. (Newswire)
  • Netflix (NFLX), Facebook (FB) – Netflix CEO Hastings will not be nominated again for election to Facebook’s board, having sat there since 2011. The move comes as concerns grown of conflict of interests as Facebook moves more into the video services. (CNBC)
  • Tesla (TSLA) – CEO Elon Musk took to twitter over the weekend, stressing that he is “crazy”, as well as saying that “the price of the Tesla Full Self-Driving option will increase substantially over time...Starting May 1.” (Newswires)
  • Tesla (TSLA), Volkswagen (VWAGY) – Volkswagen has announced that it plans to build a fully electric sports vehicle for China from 2021, a product that will take on current market leader Tesla’s Model X. (Newswire)

OTHER NEWS

  • Alnylam (ALNY) – the pharma co. announced that its Givosiran study has yielded ‘positive complete results’ in its treatment of acute hepatic porphyria. The company plans to complete its rolling submission of a New Drug Application and file a Marketing Authorisation Application by mid-2019. (WSJ)
  • Caesars (CZR) – The casinos/resorts co. is looking to appoint Anthony Rodio, current CEO of Affinity Gaming, as its new CEO, the co. also said it is evaluating takeover interest, where it is rumoured to be forming a board committee to work with investors. (WSJ)
  • Catalent (CTLT) – the pharma co. has agreed to buy Paragon Bioservices for USD 1.2bln. The deal, which will be all cash, will help Catalent expand its gene-therapy manufacturing capabilities. (WSJ)
  • Electronics for Imaging (EFII) – The printing co. is to be acquired by an affiliate of buyout firm Sirius Capital for USD 37 per share, for an all cash transaction valued at approximately USD 1.7bln. (Newswires)
  • Lyft (LYFT) – the transportation network company has recalled several thousand electric bikes in its bike-share program due to an alleged braking problem. (Newswire)

subject: Fed’s Evans (Voter, Neutral) states the US data has strengthened over the last few weeks, the economy is solid, Can envisage a scenario where fund rate to be flat/unchanged through Fall of 2020
content:
• Inflation is slightly weaker than he would like to see
  • Sees 2019 growth of 1.75% - 2%
  • Fundamentals point to growth
  • It is concerning by inflation running under 2%
  • December hike was not a mistake
  • Reiterates data dependence
  • Can be data dependent until pressures lead to inflation
  • Would expect a negative shock to cut rates
  • Comfortable with monetary policy settings
  • Less capacity to cut rates if it gets to a downturn
  • Regarding Trump’s tweet on the Fed, Evans says the Fed has to pay attention to data and mandate

subject: PREVIEW: Goldman Sachs (GS) Q1 2019 earnings due 1230 BST/0730 EDT
content:
ESTIMATED EARNINGS RELEASE TIME: 1230 BST/0730 EDT

  • CONSTITUENT: DJIA (5.3% weight), SPX (0.3% weight).
  • SECTOR: Financials/Investment Banking & Brokerage. Peers: SCHW, ETFC, MS, RJF Other peers: BAC, C, JPM, WFC.
  • PERFORMANCE SINCE LAST REPORT (16 JAN): +17.1% (vs financials sector +5.2%, vs investment banking & brokerage sector: 7.9%)
  • PREVIOUS CLOSE (USD): 207.84
  • VWAP (USD): 5-day 204.43; 30-day 196.75; 90-day 195.91.
  • OPTIONS-IMPLIED PRICE SWING (+/-): 5.1%

Q1 2019 EXPECTATIONS:

  • Q1 EPS (USD): 4.89 (prev. 6.04 vs exp. 4.88).
  • Q1 REVENUE (USD): 8.99bln (prev. 8.1bln, +2.5% surprise, seeing GS have its best one-day performance in seven years).
  • FY EPS (USD): 2019 seen around 23.68, 2020 seen 23.38.

STOCK RATING:

  • ANALYSTS: Of 25 analysts covering GS, strong buy: 4, buy: 6, hold: 13, sell: 2, strong sell: 0.
  • RECENT RATING MOVES: 2 upgrades and 18 downgrades in the last 90 days.
  • PRICE TARGET (USD): Median 225.00 (8.25% upside vs closing price); mean PT 230.43.
  • SECTOR: S&P 500 finance sector earnings estimated to grow by 6.9% this quarter; revenue is seen rising 4.6%.

FACTORS:

  • CAPITAL MARKETS: Expectations have eased through the quarter as BAC and C guided FICC income lower (to mid-teens and single digits, respectively), although recent numbers from JPM last week offer some encouragement.
  • NIM/NII: RBC expects continued growth in net income, saying that compared to the year-ago period, EPS growth is likely to be underpinned by net interest margin expansion resulting in higher net interest income.
  • SHARE BUYBACKS/DIVIDENDS: Quarterly dividend USD 0.80/shr (paid 28 March, ex-div on 27 Feb). Expected to rise to 85c/shr in Q2. The 2018 capital plan was conditioned on GS not returning more than USD 6.3bln of capital between Q3 2018 to Q2 2019; the plan had an authorisation to repurchase USD 5bln of common stock and USD 1.3bln of common stock dividends. Barclays says the repurchase plan remains within the range of expectations GS laid out in April 2018, but while it repurchased around 50% of this figure in 2H 2019; analysts are watching if GS can maintain dividends in the face of increased litigation from the 1MDB scandal.
  • BUSINESS REVIEW: Management is conducting a comprehensive business review of all divisions. Later in the year, this review will be used to provide company financial targets. Updates on this will be eyed.
  • REVENUE INITIATIVE: The USD 5bln revenue boost initiative announced in 2017 to improve its financial health, and aimed to be achieved by 2020. The USD 5bln is seen coming from opportunities in FICC (USD 1bln+), lending and financing (USD 2bln+), investment banking (USD 0.5bln+), investment management (USD 1bln+), and equities (USD 0.5bln+).
  • PREVIOUS EARNINGS REPORT (Q4 2018, released 16 Jan): GS Q4 2018 earnings beat was driven by lower than expected tax rate, better than expected advisory fees, cost control measures (expenses -2% Y/Y) offsetting weaker than expected capital markets numbers (FICC -18% Y/Y on the back of lower net revenues in credit and rate products, equities +17% Y/Y on an 80% increase in equities client execution revenues). Investors were encouraged that share repurchases continued despite charges around the 1MDB scandal (net litigation provisions rose to USD 516mln for Q4, and were USD 844mln for the FY 18). It was David Solomon's first earnings report as GS CEO, and investors were encouraged by his performance.

 

Source: Barclays, RANsquawk, RBC, Refinitiv, Zacks.

NOTE: RANsquawk is trialling this new format for US earnings previews and would welcome your feedback. For the Q1 2019 earnings season, we will be using this format to preview earnings for companies listed on the Dow Jones Industrial Average only.

Nomura Quants say CTAs have been adding US equities via futures; discretionary players focused on ‘buying on earnings reality’
content:
• SPX closed above 2900 on Friday, and Nomura estimates CTA’s may have been resuming adding longs via futures; Nomura also believes CTAs are adding mechanically buying S&P 500 futures, Nasdaq 100 futures and Russel 2000 futures.
  • “That said, these US stock market gains, while finding some support from an improvement in some Chinese economic indicators and US corporate earnings, seem to still be fuelled largely by trend-following fast-money participants, who are taking an approach of getting in and then back out quickly.,” Nomura says, “in contrast, equity long/short funds and global macro hedge funds that trade primarily on fundamentals seem to refrain from simply chasing prices up.”
  • Nomura notes that with US earnings announcements getting into swing, “markets are now focused on how much potential there is for ‘buying on reality’ by such discretionary players—that is, buying stocks in response to positive earnings surprises.”

subject: RANsquawk Daily US Opening News - 15th April 2019
content:
To download the report, please click here If you would like to subscribe to receive the research sheets directly in your inbox, you can now do so under the Research Suite section of the portal.To subscribe simply check the box next to "Email these reports" under the desired category.

  • A relatively cautious start to the week for European equities [Euro Stoxx 50 U/C], as the overnight optimism faded.
  • On the trade front EU countries have agreed to begin negotiations with the US; separately, the US have reportedly softened subsidies demands with China
  • Looking ahead, highlights include New York Fed Manufacturing, Fed’s Evans, BoE’s Haskel
  • Earnings: M&T Bank Corp, Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, Charles Schwab

 

GLOBAL

IMF stated that global expansion continues but at a weaker pace than anticipated in October last year, while it added that risks remain tilted to the downside but sees global growth firming next year. (Newswires)

ASIA-PAC

Asian equity markets began the week mostly positive as the region took impetus from last Friday’s gains on Wall St. where sentiment was underpinned by a strong start to earnings season and encouraging Chinese data. Nonetheless, ASX 200 (U/C) was dampened amid tentativeness ahead of key earnings and underperformance in gold miners, as well as trade-related news including a further decline of Chinese imports and dispute at the WTO on Australia's restriction on Chinese 5G technology. The rest of the major Asia-Pac indices are mixed as recent advances in USD/JPY fuelled the upside in Nikkei 225 (+1.4%), while Hang Seng (-0.3%) and Shanghai Comp. (-0.3%) finished lower but were initially boosted as most of the recent Chinese data surpassed estimates including New Yuan Loans, Aggregate Financing, Trade Balance and Exports with the latter at a 5-month high. Furthermore, reports the US softened its demands on China for reducing state industrial subsidies and that both sides have agreed to measures to avoid China currency manipulation, added to the hopes for a looming trade deal. Finally, 10yr JGBs were softer as they tracked the recent losses in T-notes and with demand also dampened by gains in riskier assets as well as a lack of BoJ presence in the market today.

PBoC skipped open market operations for a net neutral daily position. (Newswires) PBoC set CNY mid-point at 6.7112 (Prev. 6.7220)

US reportedly softened demands on China for reducing state industrial subsidies as condition for a trade deal according to sources. In related news, US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin commented that both US and China are making commitments and that they are close to the final round, while he also noted also noted that imbalances must be addresses across Europe. (Newswires)

China officials told the WTO that Australia's restriction on Chinese 5G technology is discriminative and appear to violate WTO rules. (Newswires)

Chinese Commerce Ministry says they will review anti-dumping and anti-subsidy measures on distiller grains form the US. (Newswires)

GEOPOLITICAL

US President Trump tweeted that he agrees that his personal relationship with North Korea leader Kim remains very good and that a 3rd summit between the leaders would be good. (Newswires).

US

US President Trump suggested the stock market would have been higher by 5000-10000 points and GDP would be well above 4% instead of 3% if the Fed had done its job correctly, while he added quantitative tightening was a killer and the Fed should have done the opposite. (Twitter)

EU countries have agreed to start trade negotiations with the US. (Newswires)

UK/EU

UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Hammond reportedly hinted that PM May could stay on as PM until October. (Newswires/PoliticsHome)

Former Conservative Party leader Iain Duncan Smith has called on UK PM May to resign next month and said that her timetable to resign should stand even though she has so far failed to pass the withdrawal agreement. (Guardian) Subsequently, Former UK Foreign Secretary Johnson will not push for PM May to quit her position before Brexit, friends of the current frontrunner to become Britain's next PM have told Business Insider. (Twitter)

UK Foreign Secretary Hunt states that Brexit talks with the Labour Party are more in-depth and constructive than people expected. Prior to this, UK Cabinet Office Minister Lidington said would like government and Labour to agree on a binding mechanism for a way forward, while he added there is still a possibility for customs union compromises and that the government remains against a second referendum. Lidington adds that the two sides would ‘take stock’ in 10 days and that the process could not drag out. (Newswires/BBC) ’10 days’ would approximately align with April 23rd when MPs are to return from Easter Break.

40% of CFOs expect BoE to hike rates over next 12 months vs. Prev. 58% in the prior quarter, according to a Deloitte survey. (Newswires)

ECB's Villeroy said monetary policy must stay accommodative and that there is no global recession in sight. (Newswires)

ECB's nowcasting model signalled 0.2% growth in Q1 and a possible slight slowdown in Q2, according to sources. (Newswires)

Finland Social Democrats and Nationalist Finns Party are almost tied in first place following the final results of the general election with 17.7% and 17.5% of votes respectively. (Newswires)

UK Rightmove House Prices (Apr) M/M 1.1% (Prev. 0.4%). (Newswires) UK Rightmove House Prices (Apr) Y/Y -0.1% (Prev. -0.8%)

EQUITIES

A tepid start to the week for European equities thus far (Eurostoxx 50 Unch) after the optimism seen in Asia somewhat waned, although Japan’s Nikkei 225 closed higher by almost 1.5% amid currency tailwind. In Europe, Italy’s FTSE MIB (+0.5%) bodes well as the bourse hit eight-month highs, bolstered by banking names amidst the optimism surrounding US banks’ earnings (ahead of Goldman Sachs and Citigroup earnings today). As such the banking sector in Europe outperforms (Stoxx 600 Banks +0.9%) whilst its peers remain mixed. In terms of individual movers, France’s Publicis Groupe (+3.2%) leads the gains in the CAC 40 (+0.1%) on the back of an optimistic revenue update, whilst also supporting its UK peer WPP (+1.3%) in tandem. Elsewhere, Covestro (-4.2%) is the marked laggard in the DAX (Unch) amid ex-dividend trade. Finally, IWG (+22.4%) rests at the top of the Stoxx 600 [Unch] after reports that Japan’s TKP are to acquire the Co.’s workspace leading unit for JPY 50bln coupled with a broker upgrade.

FX

GBP - Sterling remains underpinned and relatively optimistic after another Article 50 extension to avoid a no deal Brexit and amidst reports that talks between the Conservative and Labour Parties have been more detailed and constructive than some expected, per UK Foreign Secretary Hunt. Cable is eyeing 1.3100 again, albeit with a hefty helping hand from a broadly soft Dollar, as Eur/Gbp trades largely sideways within a 0.8633-50 range. Technically, 1.3132 (last Friday’s high) forms nearest resistance, but data could become pivotal as the week unfolds given jobs and earnings on tap tomorrow, then CPI on Wednesday and retail sales ahead of the long Easter break.

EUR - As noted above, the single currency is also firm and outperforming the Greenback as the DXY slips a bit further below 97.000 to just under 96.800. Eur/Usd is inching towards 1.1300+ upside chart levels, like a 50% Fib circa 1.1324 and the 200 WMA around 1.1341. Note also, 2 banks are long of the headline pair and looking for sizeable rallies to 1.1650 and even 1.1800.

NZD/AUD/JPY/CHF/CAD - All narrowly mixed vs the Usd with the Kiwi and Aussie both deriving some support from reports overnight suggesting the US has relaxed some demands over Chinese industrial subsidies in ongoing trade negotiations, as Nzd/Usd hovers between 0.6763-82 and Aud/Usd in a 0.7164-80 range. However, Usd/Jpy has not advanced as much as risk-on sentiment might have suggested overnight with the pair fading just shy of the 2019 peak (112.14) amidst supply from Japanese exporters according to market contacts and now revisiting the 200 WMA (111.98). Meanwhile, the Franc is sitting tight within 1.0010-28 parameters and Loonie between 1.3320-47 ahead of the BoC’s Business Outlook Survey and against the backdrop of softer oil prices that are also undermining the NOK (sub-9.6100 vs the Eur as SEK holds above 10.4700).

EM - The Try has been hit hard again and got closer to recent lows vs the Usd in wake of latest Turkish jobs data revealing a spike in the rolling 3 month average unemployment rate to 14.7% vs 13.5% previously. The Lira has nursed some losses since on the aforementioned Buck weakness, but remains on the backfoot in a 5.7600-8115 band in stark contrast to the Rand that has extended gains through 14.0000 even though one institution is anticipating a reversal in the Zar’s fortunes and rebound to 14.2700.

SNB Chairman Jordan said he sees no reason to alter monetary policy but added that they are still willing to intervene if required. (Newswires)

FIXED INCOME

The psychological 127.00 level is still capping 10yr Gilt futures with the UK benchmark extending its retreat from Liffe highs just under the aforementioned big figure (126.99) and slipping to a low of 126.69 at worst. The pull-back saw continuation trend support at 126.76 briefly breached, as positive risk sentiment pressures fixed income, and with stops noted next on the downside at 126.43. Core Eurozone debt is also hanging near lows of the day, with the German 10 yr another victim of the Chinese data driven downturn, and 164.32 highlighted as a key support level should more constructive US-China trade vibes emerge through the session.

Turning to the States, bonds and price movement has been relatively uneventful, with contracts essentially at the same level they closed at on Friday across the curve even though activity in 10 yr put options has been fairly substantial (several big blocks going through in May19 and Jun19 expiries). Ahead, traders will be keeping an eye on potential comments from Fed’s Evans for direction on a slow start to the week with only NY Fed manufacturing on the docket.

COMMODITIES

Subdued trade in the energy complex as WTI (-0.8%) and Brent (-0.8%) futures gave up some of Friday’s gains, with the latter now straddling around the psychological USD 71.00/bbl level. Friday’s CFTC data showed that hedge funds raise bullish ICE WTI crude bets by 30.7k to 281.7k lots, whilst speculators increased net long positions in Brent crude (for a fifth consecutive week) by almost 9.5k to just over 358k in the week to April 9th. Over the weekend, Russia’s Finance Minister stated that OPEC+ could decide to raise production (at the June 25/26 meeting) to fight for market share with the US. Currently OPEC+ have agreed to curb output by 1.2mln BPD until June 2019, with IFX noting that Russia’s April production fell by 150k BPD vs the benchmark October level. Back in December, Russia committed to reducing output by 228k BPD from October levels of 11.4mln BPD in a gradual manner which would take place over several months.

Elsewhere, the precious metals sector is mostly in the red with gold (-0.4%) edging lower and breaching its 100 DMA (USD 1288/oz) to the downside as last week’s Chinese data somewhat eases fears of a global growth slowdown. Meanwhile, copper (-0.3%) gave up its overnight gains as the risk sentiment became more cautious during early EU trade. Finally, Shanghai steel futures hit a seven-and-a-half year high as the alloy is supported by firm demand, whilst its base metal, Dalian iron ore futures remained near record highs on dwindling Chinese stockpiles which declined the most since 2015, according to SteelHome data.

Platts Associate Director Hickin sees Brent crude averaging close to USD 70/bbl this year, according to Business Standard. (Business Standard)

Kazakh oil output stands at 215.3K tonnes per day vs. 241.5K tonnes per day on Friday, according to sources. (Newswires)

content:
Baloise Holdings (BALN SW) – Co. is acquiring Belgium’s FIDEA for EUR 480mln. Acquisition will increase Co.’s share of attractive non-life business in Belgium to 8.5% (Prev. 6.8%) and increase market share to 4.2% (Prev. 3.5%). (Newswires)

UK home builders - UK Rightmove House Prices (Apr) M/M 1.1% (Prev. 0.4%). UK Rightmove House Prices (Apr) Y/Y -0.1% (Prev. -0.8%). (Newswires)

Clas Ohlson (CLASB SS) – March sales +4% Y/Y to SEK 605mln vs. Prev. SEK 584mln, organic sales +2% Y/Y. (Newswires)

Daimler (DAI GY) – Local market regulator in China has begun a probe into a dispute between a Mercedes Benz dealership and a customer, who alleges that they were sold a faulty vehicle. Separately, Co. have reportedly denied reports regarding emissions cheating software which was fitted on a range of Mercedes models. Follows earlier reports that, KBA, the German motor vehicle authority, is investigating the Co. on suspicion that 60k vehicles were fitted with emission cheating software (Newswires)

International Workplace Group (IWG LN) – TKP are reportedly to acquire the Co’s workspace leasing unit in Japan for YEN 50bln. (Newswires/Nikkei)

Rio Tinto (RIO LN) – Co. said it would invest USD 302mln to develop its Resolution copper project in Arizona, in an attempt to expand output. (Newswires)

Moncler (MONC IM) – CEO has ruled out acquisitions, adding that he does not want to dilute focus on Genius project (FT)

Total (FP FP) – Q1 variable cost margin of European refining is at USD 33/tonne vs. Prev. USD 29.8/tonne. (Newswires)

Italgas (IG IM) – Co’s CEO reportedly stated that they will present a non-binding bid for Italian utility company Ascopiave’s gas distribution business. (Newswires)

IG Group (IGG LN) – Andy Green has told the Co. of his intention to step down as Co’s chairman. (Newswires)

Publicis (PUB FP) - Have obtained a firm commitment from BNP Paribas and Citi regarding 12-month bridge loan which can be renewed for the Epsilon deal (Newswires/FT) 

Volkswagen (VOW3 GY) - Co's sales chief reportedly states that China demand increased in April (Newswires)

EDF (EDF FP) - Co. board are to review restructuring plans opn May 28th. (La Parisien)

Fiat Chrysler (FCA IM) - Co. are said to close sale of Magneti Marelli at the start of May. (Newswires)

subject: DAILY EUROPEAN EQUITY OPENING NEWS
content:
**EUROPEAN EQUITY COVERAGE WILL ONLY COVER COMPANIES IN THE STOXX 600 OR COMPANIES OF SYSTEMIC IMPORTANCE TO PARTICULAR SECTORS**

15th April 2019

The Daily European Equity Opening News is uploaded at 0700BST/0100CDT recapping all of the overnight equity news

From 0700BST/0100CDT all equity news will be covered in real time over the audio and headline feed and the full audio rundown will be at 0715BST/0115CDT.

There will be an additional audio rundown at 0750BST/0150CDT recapping any company news which has hit the wires since 0715BST/0115CDT ahead of the European equity open

ASIA

Asian equity markets began the week mostly positive as the region took impetus from last Friday’s gains on Wall St. where sentiment was underpinned by a strong start to earnings season and encouraging Chinese data. Nonetheless, ASX 200 (-0.1%) was the exception with the index dampened amid tentativeness ahead of key earnings and underperformance in gold miners, as well as trade-related news including a further decline of Chinese imports and dispute at the WTO on Australia's restriction on Chinese 5G technology. The rest of the major Asia-Pac indices were firmly higher as recent advances in USD/JPY fuelled the upside in Nikkei 225 (+1.4%), while Hang Seng (+0.6%) and Shanghai Comp. (+1.2%) were also boosted as most of the recent Chinese data surpassed estimates including New Yuan Loans, Aggregate Financing, Trade Balance and Exports with the latter at a 5-month high. Furthermore, reports the US softened its demands on China for reducing state industrial subsidies and that both sides have agreed to measures to avoid China currency manipulation, added to the hopes for a looming trade deal.

FTSE

British American Tobacco (BATS LN) – Co. is under pressure to replace its chairman Richard Burrows to comply with new corporate governance rules. The chairman took the position in 2009, whilst the corporate governance code, published in 2018 states that “the chair should not remain in post beyond nine years from the date of their first appointment to the board”. (The Times)

Whitbread (WB/ LN) – Co. is expected to cut over 100 head-office positions as a results of its GBP 3.9bln sale of Costa Coffee. The consultation is expected to be concluded this month, according to sources. (Newswires)

GVC (GVC LN) – Co. chairman and CEO have signed off on each others’ sale of shares (a combined GBP 20mln worth of shares) last month, which wiped 20% of Co.’s valuation in a day, according to The Times. (The Times)

William Hill (WMH LN) – Co. has to pay USD 1.2mln following Tiger Wood’s Masters win after taking on a USD 85k wager against the golfer at 14:1 odds. (Newswires)

RBS (RBS LN) – Co. have been accused of enforcing debt collection procedures which are seen as aggressive against customers with leasehold policies. (Newswires/FT)

UK companies – CMA may offer an exemption for some Co’s to proposals which would require FTSE 100 Co’s to employ two audit firms. The CMA is expected to publish its final report this week. (Sky)

OTHER UK COMPANIES

Non-Standard Financial (NSF LN) – Co. have stated that a number of their dividend payments since 2016 have broken companies law, finding a number of ‘technical infringements’. (FT)

BROKER MOVES

CENTRICA (CNA LN) DOWNGRADED TO NEUTRAL FROM OVERWEIGHT AT JPMORGAN CHASE

IWG (IWG LN) UPGRADED TO OUTPERFORM FROM UNDERPERFORM AT CREDIT SUISSE

ASOS (ASC LN) REITERATED OUTPERFORM AT RBC

DAX

Volkswagen (VOW3 GY) – Co. plans to build fully-electric SUVs for China by 2021, taking on Tesla’s (TSLA) Model X. Separately, CEO said the group is pushing its JV partners to build electric car battery plants with manufacturing capacity of at least one Gigawatt. (Newswires)

Daimler (DAI GY) – KBA, the German motor vehicle authority, is investigating the Co. on suspicion that 60k vehicles were fitted with emission cheating software. (Bild am Sonntag)

Deutsche Bank (DBK GY) – Regulators are pressing the Co. to shrink their US investment bank unit, as supervisors are concerned that the division is both too big and unprofitable, therefore needs to be cut back. (FT)

BROKER MOVES

LEG IMMOBILIEN (LEG GY) DOWNGRADED TO HOLD FROM BUY AT BANKHAUS LAMPE

CAC

Publicis (PUB FP) – Q1 revenue EUR 2.1bln vs. Exp. EUR 2.1bln. Co. affirms FY19 organic growth to be higher Y/Y, diluted EPS to be +5-10% Y/Y and operating margin to rise 30-50bps. Separately, Co. have acquired Epsilon from Alliance Data Systems for USD 4.4bln. (Newswires/FT)

Vivendi (VIV FP) – Q1 revenue EUR 3.46bln vs. Prev. EUR 3.12bln, +10.7% Y/Y. Shareholders at the Co. are due to vote on a buyback plan, regarding this a governance specialist and activist investor have asked shareholders to vote this down as this may allow the Bollore family to take greater control of the Co. (Newswires)

OTHER FRENCH COMPANIES

BROKER MOVES

SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC (SU FP) REITERATED OUTPERFORM AT RBC

PAN EUROPE

Airlines – Airlines have accumulated almost USD 2bln of extra costs since the grounding of Boeing 737 Max 8’s amid a combination of financing costs, leasing replacements, staff wages, parking and storage. Separately, Civil Aviation Authority data shows that the number of domestic UK flights has fallen by just under 20% in the past decade. (The Telegraph/FT)

Telecom Names – Germany’s telecom regulator President stated that their position is “that no equipment supplier, which includes Huawei, should or may be specifically excluded”. (FT)

Mediatset (MS IM)/ Proseibensat1 (PSM GY) – Mediaset denied reports that Cos were in merger talks. (Newswires)

BROKER MOVES

ASML (ASML NA) REITERATED OUTPERFORM AT RBC

ASML (ASML NA) REMOVED FROM CONVICTION LIST AT GOLDMAN SACHS

SMI

BROKER MOVES

SCANDINAVIA

BROKER MOVES

NOKIA (NOKIA FH) DOWNGRADED TO SELL FROM NEUTRAL AT GOLDMAN SACHS

US

content:

  • Asian indices are predominantly positive, following on from Friday’s upbeat start to US earnings season and strong Chinese data
  • US-China trade hopes bolstered on reports that an agreement has been reached on currency manipulation & US softening demands surrounding subsidies
  • Looking ahead, highlights include New York Fed Manufacturing, Fed’s Evans, BoE’s Haskel
  • Earnings:  M&T Bank Corp, Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, Charles Schwab Corp

 

GLOBAL

IMF stated that global expansion continues but at a weaker pace than anticipated in October last year, while it added that risks remain tilted to the downside but sees global growth firming next year. (Newswires) 

ASIA-PAC

Asian equity markets began the week mostly positive as the region took impetus from last Friday’s gains on Wall St. where sentiment was underpinned by a strong start to earnings season and encouraging Chinese data. (+1.2%) were also boosted as most of the recent Chinese data surpassed estimates including New Yuan Loans, Aggregate Financing, Trade Balance and Exports with the latter at a 5-month high. Furthermore, reports the US softened its demands on China for reducing state industrial subsidies and that both sides have agreed to measures to avoid China currency manipulation, added to the hopes for a looming trade deal. Finally, 10yr JGBs were softer as they tracked the recent losses in T-notes and with demand also dampened by gains in riskier assets as well as a lack of BoJ presence in the market today.

PBoC skipped open market operations for a net neutral daily position. (Newswires) PBoC set CNY mid-point at 6.7112 (Prev. 6.7220)

US reportedly softened demands on China for reducing state industrial subsidies as condition for a trade deal according to sources. In related news, US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin commented that both US and China are making commitments and that they are close to the final round, while he also noted also noted that imbalances must be addresses across Europe. (Newswires)

China officials told the WTO that Australia's restriction on Chinese 5G technology is discriminative and appear to violate WTO rules. (Newswires)

UK/EU

UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Hammond said the government is prepared to talk about a customs union, while he also reportedly hinted that PM May could stay on as PM until October. (Newswires/PoliticsHome)

UK Cabinet Office Minister Lidington said would like government and Labour to agree on a binding mechanism for a way forward, while he added there is still a possibility for customs union compromises and that the government remains against a second referendum. Lidington adds that the two sides would ‘take stock’ in 10 days and that the process could not drag out. (BBC) ’10 days’ would approximately align with April 23rd when MPs are to return from Easter Break. (Newswires)

Former Conservative Party leader Iain Duncan Smith has called on UK PM May to resign next month and said that her timetable to resign should stand even though she has so far failed to pass the withdrawal agreement. (Guardian)

40% of CFOs expect BoE to hike rates over next 12 months vs. Prev. 58% in the prior quarter, according to a Deloitte survey. (Newswires)

ECB's Villeroy said monetary policy must stay accommodative and that there is no global recession in sight. (Newswires)

ECB's nowcasting model signalled 0.2% growth in Q1 and a possible slight slowdown in Q2, according to sources. (Newswires)

Finland Social Democrats and Nationalist Finns Party are almost tied in first place following the final results of the general election with 17.7% and 17.5% of votes respectively. (Newswires)

S&P affirmed Germany at AAA, Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

UK Rightmove House Prices (Apr) M/M 1.1% (Prev. 0.4%). (Newswires) UK Rightmove House Prices (Apr) Y/Y -0.1% (Prev. -0.8%)

FX

In FX markets, the DXY was softer after its recent failure to hold on to the 97.00 level and as the mostly positive risk tone weighed on haven demand, while President Trump also renewed his criticism on the Fed. As such, the greenback’s major counterparts benefitted in which GBP/USD tested 1.3100 to the upside and EUR/USD extended on gains after having found support at the 1.1300 level and its nearby 50DMA at 1.1301, while Nordea also went long on the single currency with a target of 1.1650 and considers a stop loss at 1.1187. Elsewhere, the firm risk appetite kept USD/JPY near YTD highs around 112.00 and antipodeans were also underpinned by the risk tone, albeit to a lesser extent for AUD/USD following the decline in Chinese imports.

SNB Chairman Jordan said he sees no reason to alter monetary policy but added that they are still willing to intervene if required. (Newswires)

COMMODITIES

Commodities were mixed overnight in which WTI crude futures failed to benefit from the mostly positive risk tone with prices at the lower end of last week’s tight range below the USD 64.00/bbl level as the support from recent supply side risks wane. Elsewhere, gold languished beneath USD 1300/oz with the safe haven weighed as the recent Chinese data helped ease global slowdown concerns, while copper held on to most of the Friday’s China data-driven gains as Dalian iron ore futures remained near record highs on dwindling Chinese stockpiles which fell the most since 2015 according to SteelHome data.

Baker Hughes (April 12): oil rigs +2 at 833, gas rigs -5 at 189, total rigs -3 at 1022. (Newswires)

GEOPOLITICS

US President Trump tweeted that he agrees that his personal relationship with North Korea leader Kim remains very good and that a 3rd summit between the leaders would be good. (Newswires). 

US

Following an upbeat set of China data, that reassured investors about the stabilisation seen in the World’s second largest economy, the risk tone became constructive, although the reaction was somewhat delayed. The result was selling of the Treasury curve, and yields are higher by between 4bps and 6.5bps at settlement. The selling saw a pause after a soft Michigan survey, which lifted the T-Note off of lows. Major curve spreads were mixed into a quiet close. US T-note futures (M9) settled 15 ticks lower at 123-03.

US President Trump suggested the stock market would have been higher by 5000-10000 points and GDP would be well above 4% instead of 3% if the Fed had done its job correctly, while he added quantitative tightening was a killer and the Fed should have done the opposite. (Twitter)

In FX markets, the DXY is softer after its recent failure to hold on to the 97.00 level and with the mostly positive risk tone weighing on haven demand, while President Trump also renewed his criticism on the Fed. As such, the greenback’s major counterparts are firmer with GBP/USD testing 1.3100 to the upside and with EUR/USD extending on gains after having found support at the 1.1300 level and its nearby 50DMA at 1.1301, while Nordea has also gone long on the pair with a target of 1.1650 and considers a stop loss at 1.1187.
